required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exploratory Study on the Role of Somatic Modulation in Hyperacusis
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Study on the Role of Somatic Modulation in Hyperacusis

brief_summary.textblock: This study focuses on patients with a primary complaint of hyperacusis. Hyperacusis has been defined as 'abnormally reduced tolerance to sound' and is commonly associated with tinnitus. The effects of somatic modulation upon tinnitus have been studied, but not so for hyperacusis.. The effect of 9 somatic modulations (i.e. 3 jaw modulations and 6 cervical spine modulations) and 1 control movement (i.e. without any somatic modulation effect) in random order on the sound tolerance of a 1 kilohertz (kHz) broadband noise sound and the tinnitus experience will be investigated. More specifically, the perceived loudness and intrusiveness of this sound and the tinnitus sound will be evaluated before somatic modulation and during the somatic modulation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of hyperacusis (loudness and intrusiveness) after modulation
primary_outcome.description: Change in hyperacusis loudness and intrusiveness rating by use of a visual analogue scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of tinnitus (loudness and intrusiveness) after modulation
secondary_outcome.description: Change in tinnitus loudness and intrusiveness rating by use of a visual analogue scale

intervention.description: Type of modulations: 3 jaw and 6 cervical spine modulations, 1 control movement (i.e. without any expected somatic modulation effect) Jaw modulations: laterotrusion to the left, laterotrusion to the right and protrusion Cervical spine modulations: isometric flexion, extension and left and right lateroflexion of the head against resistance of the investigator's hand, compression and traction of the cervical spine in sitting position. Control movement: the investigator's hand rests against the patient's forehead without any force application

study_pop.textblock: The study will be aimed at adults experiencing a primary complaint of hyperacusis (i.e. abnormally reduced tolerance to sound).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary complaint of hyperacusis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Primary complaint of tinnitus

reference.citation: Shore SE. Plasticity of somatosensory inputs to the cochlear nucleus--implications for tinnitus. Hear Res. 2011 Nov;281(1-2):38-46. doi: 10.1016/j.heares.2011.05.001. Epub 2011 May 18. Review.
Baguley DM, Hoare DJ. Hyperacusis: major research questions. HNO. 2018 May;66(5):358-363. doi: 10.1007/s00106-017-0464-3. Review.
Baguley DM. Hyperacusis. J R Soc Med. 2003 Dec;96(12):582-5. Review.
